description.other_details: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/.

Singer DE, Chang Y, Borowsky LH, Fang MC, Pomernacki NK, Udaltsova N, Reynolds K, Go AS. A new risk scheme to predict ischemic stroke and other thromboembolism in atrial fibrillation: the ATRIA study stroke risk score. Journal of the American Heart Association. 2013 Jun 18;2(3):e000250.

details.purpose: Att registrera poäng genererad i enlighet med ATRIA stroke risk score. Instrumentet baseras på åtta faktorer; tidigare stroke, ålder, kön, komorbiditet, proteinuri och eGFR < 45ml/min (alt terminal njursvikt). Instrumentet är validerat, och används för uppskattning av strokerisk och som riktlinje för optimal behandling med antikoagulantia hos patienter med förmaksflimmer.
details.misuse: Endast avsedd för patienter med diagnosticerat förmaksflimmer.

details.purpose: To record the results for each component parameter and their total sum for the ATRIA stroke risk score.
details.use: Use to record the results for each component parameter and their total sum for the ATRIA stroke risk score.
details.misuse: Do not use if the patient does not have atrial fibrillation.

items.items: An assessment tool used to determine the risk of stroke in patients with atrial fibrillation.
Does the individual have a history of cerebrovascular accident/stroke?
What is the age and has the individual ever had a prior stroke?
Is the individual male or female?
Does the individual have a history of diabetes mellitus?
Does the individual have a history of congestive heart failure?
Does the individual have a history of hypertension?
The estimated glomerular filtration rate (based on MDRD equation) or presence of end-stage renal disease (ESRD).
Sum of points assigned for each of the component parameters.
Age <65 years with no history of stroke.
Age 65-74 years with no history of stroke.
Age 75-84 years with no history of stroke.
Age ≥85 years with no history of stroke.
Age 65-84 years with a history of stroke.
Age <65 years with a history of stroke.
Age ≥85 years with a history of stroke.
Estimated GFR equal or greater than 45 ml/min/1.73m2
Estimated GFR less than 45 ml/min/1.73m2 or presence of end-stage renal disease (ESRD)
No history of congestive heart failure.
Positive history of congestive heart failure.
Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.

ATRIA (anticoagulation and risk factors in atrial fibrillation) stroke risk score används för att uppskatta strokerisk hos patienter med förmaksflimmer. Instrumentet baseras på ett antal kända riskfaktorer: tidigare stroke, ålder, kön, komorbiditet, proteinuri och eGFR < 45ml/min (alt terminal njursvikt). Poängen uppgår till maximalt 15p. En poäng om 0-5 indikerar mindre än 1%, 6p 1->2% och >6p >2% risk för stroke.
Har individen tidigare genomgått cerebrovaskulär sjukdom/stroke?
Patientens ålder sammanvägd med tidigare stroke.
Är patienten diagnosticerad med diabetes mellitus?
Patientens uppskattade GFR alternativt terminal njursvikt.
*Sum of points assigned for each of the component parameters. (en)
*Estimated GFR equal or greater than 45 ml/min/1.73m2(en)
*Estimated GFR less than 45 ml/min/1.73m2 or presence of end-stage renal disease (ESRD)(en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms. (en)
*For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents. (en)
